intro: Galium montis-arerae, commonly known as the Alpine bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule. Galium montis-arerae is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
